title: How does each chemical bond (ionic, metallic, and covalent) satisfy the octet rule? - Quora

response.answer_text: For ionic - the atoms lose or gain electrons to have a full valence shell (The shell which contains eight electrons) For Covalent - The atoms share electrons to obtain the full outer shell. The octet rule means the atoms need to have eight electrons in their outermost shell
They satisfy the octect rule by having eight electrons in the outermost shell of each atom.
